snippet: Propelled by the ratings for the Super Bowl - whose 111.3 million viewers made it the most-watched event in TV history - the NBC singing competition scored a 16.3 rating among the 18- to 49-year-old viewers and attracted 37.6 million viewers.
abstract: Propelled by the ratings for the Super Bowl - whose 111.3 million viewers made it the most-watched event in TV history - the NBC singing competition scored a 16.3 rating among the 18- to 49-year-old viewers and attracted 37.6 million viewers.
lead_paragraph: Whatever hopes NBC had for the second-season premiere of the singing competition "The Voice," it surely surpassed them, with an impressive performance after the Super Bowl on Sunday. "The Voice" scored the best rating for a show following the game since 2006, when ABC broadcast an episode of "Grey's Anatomy."

headline.main: 'The Voice' Follows the Super Bowl to Rare Ratings Heights
